headline: Ookinete-specific expression with female gametocyte preference in Plasmodium berghei
one_paragraph_summary:
This gene exhibits dramatic stage-specific expression in Plasmodium berghei, with its most striking feature being >100-fold upregulation in ookinetes (>2000 TPM) compared to all other life cycle stages. Expression patterns show sexual stage preference, with moderate levels in gametocytes (~30-60 TPM) and particularly strong female gametocyte bias (6-fold higher than males). The gene shows minimal expression in asexual blood stages (~1 TPM) and variable, generally low expression during liver stages.
  • Ookinete-specific expression suggests critical roles in mosquito stage development and transmission
  • Female gametocyte preference indicates involvement in sexual differentiation processes
  • Regulation by AP2 transcription factors suggests integration into sexual development pathways

topics.headline: Dramatic ookinete-specific upregulation with partial AP2 transcription factor regulation
topics.one_sentence_summary: The gene shows >100-fold upregulation in ookinetes compared to other life cycle stages, with AP2-O3 knockout reducing ookinete expression by ~70% while AP2-O2 knockout shows minimal impact.

topics.headline: Female gametocyte-biased expression during sexual differentiation
topics.one_sentence_summary: Expression is strongly biased toward female gametocytes (6-fold higher than males) and shows early activation during gametocyte commitment with biphasic peaks at 0 and 12 hours post-induction.
